Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>「雲海にそびえし古の塔」<White>か……そんな高い塔なら、 目につかないはずないと思うんだけど。
Entry.EnglishText: "<Cyan>The ancient tower which soars above a sea of clouds<White>..." Don't you think you'd notice a tower that tall?

Entry.JapaneseText: という事は、それほど高くないか、 何かの例えか……
Entry.EnglishText: In that case, it might not even be that tall, or perhaps it's some sort of metaphor...

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……世界には、まだまだ俺たちの 知らない事がたくさんある。
Entry.EnglishText: No... There are still many things in this world that we have no knowledge of.

Entry.JapaneseText: もしかして俺たちの知らないどこかに、 そのような塔があるのかもしれない。
Entry.EnglishText: Perhaps there is such a tower in a place unknown to us.
There's things that even you don't know about?

Entry.JapaneseText: 当然だ。 まだまだ俺も勉強不足だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Of course. There is still much I have yet to learn.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふぇぇ、じゃあ、どれだけ勉強すればいいの？
Entry.EnglishText: Sheesh... Well then, how much should I study?

Entry.JapaneseText: 生涯、勉強は完わらん…… 日々是精進なり……
Entry.EnglishText: There is never an end to it during one's lifetime... Dedicate yourself to learning every day.
